explanation.num_tested_probands: INFERRED: 'A 31-year-old man was referred to our movement disorders outpatient clinic at the age of 30 years.' - This suggests a single proband was tested in this study.
explanation.num_positive_het_probands: No relevant information found. The text describes the proband as having 'biallelic variants in WARS2,' which implies compound heterozygosity rather than simple heterozygosity.
explanation.positive_phenotypes: EXPLICIT: 'a clinically prominent hyperkinetic movement disorder with dystonia, chorea, and ballism.'; EXPLICIT: 'a severe hyperkinetic movement disorder and cognitive deficits.'; INFERRED: 'ballistic movements and a stepwise loss of already acquired skills' - This suggests developmental regression.
explanation.num_compound_or_double_hets: EXPLICIT: 'we prioritized genes carrying biallelic variants in the index and detected 2 variants in WARS2' - This indicates the proband is a compound heterozygote. INFERRED: 'The paternally inherited missense variant... The maternally inherited c.149G>A, p.Gly50Asp missense variant' - This further supports the presence of compound heterozygosity in the proband.
